alert.note: Alert for Dougherty; Lee; Terrell; Worth (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 03 at 6:53PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Dougherty, Lee, southeastern Terrell and northwestern Worth Counties through 730 PM EDT... At 653 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles northeast of Turner City, or 11 miles east of Leesburg, moving west at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Leesburg, Albany, Putney, East Albany, Marine Corps Logistics Base, Turner City, Walker, Warwick, Sasser, Stocks, Radium Springs, Forrester, Lockett Crossing, South Albany, Southwest Ga Regional A/P, Palmyra, Red Rock, Acree, Williamsburg and Chickasawhatchee. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
